xxl.core.xml.storage
Class LiteralNode

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.xml.storage.Node
      xxl.core.xml.storage.LiteralNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable
public class LiteralNode
extends Node

This class is an extention of the abstract class Node. It has the role of an literal (simple String) as we know from XML documents. An literal node cannot have child nodes, but can standalone.

getObject

public Object getObject()
Returns the value of this literal-node according to the type. If the type is i.e. INTEGER_8_BIT then the return value will be a Byte. if type=FLOAT then the return value will be a Float.......

Returns:
the value of this node converted into a java-Object according to the type of this node.

getType

public int getType()
Returns Node.LITERAL_NODE, because this is a MarkupNode. Returns Node.LITERAL_NODE.

Specified by:

Returns:
the type of the node.
